```{r setup, include=FALSE}
rm(list=ls())
library(dplyr)
```

## 

```{r}
data=read.csv("AB_NYC_2019.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

```


```{r}
#Describing the dataset
summary(data)
str(data)
dim(data)
colnames(data)

```

## Cleaning the dataset

```{r}
#ID column
class(data$id)
sum(is.na(data$id))
```


```{r}
#Name column
class(data$name)
data%>%distinct(name)
```
```{r}
# Host id column
class(data$host_id)
sum(is.na(data$host_id))
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
